org.mozilla.gecko.util

Class DateUtil

  • Object
    • org.mozilla.gecko.util.DateUtil

  • public class DateUtil
extends Object
    Utilities to help with manipulating Java's dates and calendars.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static String getDateInHTTPFormat(java.util.Date date) 
      static int getTimezoneOffsetInMinutes(java.util.TimeZone timezone)
      Returns the timezone offset for the current date in minutes.
      static int getTimezoneOffsetInMinutesForGivenDate(java.util.Calendar calendar)
      Returns the time zone offset for the given date in minutes.

      • Methods inherited from class Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getDateInHTTPFormat

        public static String getDateInHTTPFormat(@NonNull
                                         java.util.Date date)
        Parameters:
        date - the date to convert to HTTP format
        Returns:
        the date as specified in rfc 1123, e.g. "Tue, 01 Feb 2011 14:00:00 GMT"

      • getTimezoneOffsetInMinutes

        public static int getTimezoneOffsetInMinutes(@NonNull
                                             java.util.TimeZone timezone)
        Returns the timezone offset for the current date in minutes. See getTimezoneOffsetInMinutesForGivenDate(Calendar) for more details.

      • getTimezoneOffsetInMinutesForGivenDate

        public static int getTimezoneOffsetInMinutesForGivenDate(@NonNull
                                                         java.util.Calendar calendar)
        Returns the time zone offset for the given date in minutes. The date makes a difference due to daylight savings time in some regions. We return minutes because we can accurately represent time zones that are offset by non-integer hour values, e.g. parts of New Zealand at UTC+12:45.
        Parameters:
        calendar - A calendar with the appropriate time zone & date already set.
